title.value: Pandemic policy assessment by artificial intelligence
title.justification: The title clearly indicates the focus of the research, which is on the assessment of pandemic policies using artificial intelligence.
title.quote: Pandemic policy assessment by artificial intelligence

extractions.description: The paper presents a system that uses artificial intelligence to assess and analyze pandemic control policies, specifically focusing on mobility-control policies. It employs a reinforcement-learning oracle within a general simulation framework to evaluate the effectiveness, complexity, and cost-benefit of different policies such as city lockdown, community quarantine, and route management.

type.justification: The paper describes the application of a developed system on real-world data to evaluate pandemic policies, indicating empirical research.
type.quote: We applied the system to real-world metropolitan data and evaluated three popular policies.

name.justification: The primary research field involves using artificial intelligence to analyze public policies, especially in the context of pandemic policy assessment.
name.quote: In this paper, we propose a pandemic policy assessment system that employs AI to support policy analysis.

name.justification: The paper discusses using a reinforcement-learning oracle to execute pandemic policy evaluations.
name.quote: The oracle utilizes multiple RL models to execute each policy.

name.justification: The research is directly related to assessing policies for pandemic control, which is a core aspect of epidemiology.
name.quote: Mobility-control policies have been widely adopted for pandemic prevention.

name.justification: DURLECA is explicitly mentioned as an RL system enhanced by GNN used in the study.
name.quote: Our RL system, named DURLECA, is enhanced by a specially designed GNN.

is_contributed.justification: The model DURLECA is part of their proposed system and is newly applied within this research.
is_contributed.quote: Our RL system, named DURLECA, is enhanced by a specially designed GNN.

is_executed.justification: The model is used to simulate and evaluate different policies, indicating execution.
is_executed.quote: Then, the RL agent of DURLECA periodically determines the extent of mobility restrictions.

is_compared.justification: It is used to simulate different policies and compare the results obtained.
is_compared.quote: With additional execution complexity analysis (introduced later), the results of different RL-based policies can serve as an informative reference for policy-makers to assess and compare policies.

referenced_paper_title.value: Reinforced Epidemic Control: Saving Both Lives and Economy
referenced_paper_title.justification: The title is mentioned in connection with the RL algorithm used in the system.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The simulation framework and RL algorithm used in this paper were initially presented at the SIGKDD 2020 Health Day Workshop, Reinforced Epidemic Control: Saving Both Lives and Economy.

name.justification: The dataset used in experiments comes from the mobility data collected in Beijing.
name.quote: The mobility-control framework is built on real-world mobility data from Beijing in Jan. 2019.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset description is available in the paper, but no reference paper for the dataset use is mentioned.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The mobility-control framework is built on real-world mobility data from Beijing in Jan. 2019.

name.justification: DURLECA is described as a reinforcement learning framework, indicating it's a library of algorithms.
name.quote: Our RL system, named DURLECA, is enhanced by a specially designed GNN.

referenced_paper_title.value: Reinforced Epidemic Control: Saving Both Lives and Economy
referenced_paper_title.justification: The DURLECA framework connects to this reference title as it was initially presented there.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The simulation framework and RL algorithm used in this paper were initially presented at the SIGKDD 2020 Health Day Workshop, Reinforced Epidemic Control: Saving Both Lives and Economy.
